oeS7m-H79jHEnfKolTBxLw.text: Been here few times never had pizza ...we ordered pizza this time and MAN! was it good ~      Nice lite crust, not tomato paste for sauce, great cheese just really really good pie......     We like the food here so shouldn't be surprised the pizza was soooo delicious. I also like that the servers are Italian, just seems more inviting to me.    Also the Italian pastries in front are classic Italian and tasty too ~

yWpEoPQ6N_yv35WqR7X3rA.text: If you haven't tried Trattoria Italia yet, gooooo! We've been here a handful of times and each time, the food was excellent. They can get pretty busy, but service is still great and they have a tempting dessert display at the front counter - definitely worth grabbing a few things on the way out.  I love a good calamari and theirs doesn't disappoint. The insalata is delish and so filling - greens, roasted peppers, artichoke hearts, tomatoes and mozzarella. I'm getting hungry just writing this review! The fettuccini bolognese tastes like the sauce has been simmering on the stove all day and the lasagna is flavorful without being too rich or cheesy.  They take reservations so be sure to call ahead!

TA3yvMyDZNIGBgZv2By8yw.text: Okay here's the thing, the food and service?! 5 stars! Really delicious and a home style feel good Italia meal at very reasonable prices. The place has a hole in the wall kind of feel. It's a little gem. I must say though, the tv projection on the back wall is totally off putting. Enough to knock off two stars. It's not a sports bar, and I don't want to watch Clorox toilet cleaning commercials on a huge screen as I'm trying to enjoy a romantic dinner. And then they had on some kind of Spanish soap opera? It's very random and not al all keeping with the tone of the restaraunt. Why not play old black and white Italian movies? If not something on theme with the restaraunt they should have nothing playing at all quite honestly.

8id0FZx7oFFheCXNtdKS3w.text: Excellent food, True Italian.  I am very fussy about Italian food, as I am Italian.   Service is great, but the rolls they serve with dinner were hard and not very tasty.  But all in all I would give this restaurant a 4 12 stars!!

l93JPP9Bq8glNNY02gAk0w.text: Been coming a long time.   Sad to say they've upped the corkage fee on us bringing our own wine.  Now corkage fee is more expensive than any entree bought tonight.   If you're going to raise the corkage fee get a better wine list.  Otherwise let good repeat customers bring their own wine to enjoy.

S0jET5P1dAiJs0pB9eLRqg.text: Denied service on Valentine's Day due to being a solo guest. Perhaps they didn't realize I was here to eat away my sorrows? Poor service.

Dx2ybWfTvGboW-bCBU5mXA.text: My food was amazing!!!! I had a gathering with 10 friends in the new expansion. it's great for private parties. The customer service was also great!  It's a family style restaurant,  I ordered the antipasto misto and carbonara. So good!!!  Everything was seasoned well and cooked to perfection.I'll be back!!!

oQoFTvNM3NyaZB-gjQDNcA.text: Best restaurant italian restaurant in henderson, home made food, best service and food so tasty

h2WzKU7O9j_8mmC_xfV7bA.text: Totally amazing. We split a flavorful Italian salad that was dressed perfectly, loaded with olives, marinated roasted red peppers, mozzarella and artichokes. The entrees we chose were gnocchi ninni, chicken piccata, chicken Parmesan sandwich and orecchiette in a garlic oil with sausage and broccoli rabe.  My gnocchi came from heaven right into my plate. The sauce was a marscapone base with roasted red peppers, garlic and spinach. Creamy, dreamy, plenty to take home.   Most remarkable is the service, a family that made us feel like family. And the prices make this one of the TOP VALUES around. Grazie, Trattoria Italia, until the next time!

V2Ccysgm_nCO2inkH5DYYQ.text: I just ate here the food was great,the atmosphere is charming ,family owned and very nice people and they have gluten free

auE8sw1ZN0Cr9mLrj74-EQ.text: First off, the store itself is slightly hard to find. But it was truly a fantastic meal. Milena was able to welcome us and make us feel at home.  She offered great suggestions. The appetizers were great. Get the Arancini, for they were the biggest surprise.  Fantastic texture and taste. Her brother, Pasquale, kept our table and our food moving. Will be back sopn.

9s5gxMjN_IAbW5yipl4sBQ.text: I'm not too much of an Italian food person, but once in a while I do get a craving. Their Antipasto appetizer was yummy. I just wish there was more cheese offered.   Their chicken marsala is pretty delicious as well. Got a side of mushrooms and mixed some in, since I'm a big mushroom fan, although the side of mushrooms could have been a great side by itself. Great flavor. The meat sauce that came with the baked penne was yummy as well. There really wasn't a lack of flavor on anything.   For dessert, had the cannolis. Great way to end a nice meal. Yes, their meals are by all means not cheap, but you really get a great serving. Plenty of food for leftovers that were equally good the next day. If ever I get the craving for Italian again, I'll visit this place for sure.

xCBZY_OmMnmtA-zD7rQ5MA.text: We went for dinner with friend's on NYE. The food was good, except for the my husband's order was wrong. The service from beginning to end was horrible.   We had to reach out to our server to get our drinks. We never got bread when every table around us did. When the meal came I realized I was not getting my soup :(  The food was good but it was not very hot. We then ordered coffee and that was not hot. We did receive a comped desert of cookies and mini cannoli's. The table agreed that was the best part of this experience.   When my husband received the check the server told us that she said she was sorry once already. She then took $9.00 off the check.   All my husband's customers had good things to say. We had high hopes. We were good customer's of Montesanto's. I hope they get their act together.  I grew up in the restaurant business in South Florida and they need to make some changes.

fpcB0lvYT3dLWfSD6dtcgA.text: I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo & the Calamari Taormina.  The fettuccine was cooked perfectly, but the alfredo sauce was lacking in flavor.  I even tried to dress it up w/ Parmesan cheese & additional spices, but that didn't help.  The shrimp & calamari in the Calamari Taormina were overcooked & the zucchini was so scarce that it shouldn't even be mentioned in the description.  The garlic knots were the best part of the meal.  I ordered the items for delivery through Grubhub.  Not sure if that made an impact on the quality.

oBWIoIRpCTP2EZzQSFoCTg.text: My wife is from upper New York with a strong Italian family. It is hard to find Italian food that will bring her back to what her family would cook. This place did just that with the food but also the wine. This is now one her favorite restaurants.

OrWOGuXVw8C0lDbLycLu2A.text: This was a wonderful find on our first night in Vegas.  We were on our way to another place and happened upon it in a shopping center.  We were in a mood for pizza and saw the reviews so we decided to try it out.  It was delicious!  Everything from the starter knots and salad to the wonderful pizza and we finished with some yummy cookies.    The dough of the knots and pizza crust were so perfectly crunchy yet chewy.  The cheese was so delicious I could have just ordered a cheese pizza.  The mushrooms were sauteed before and delicious.  I hope we will have another meal while in town to try some other menu items!

5c4wrinGZR9Rr6NuXMfVww.text: This is the new Italian restaurant that moved into the old montessano's space on eastern Ave in Henderson.  We had spaghetti and meatballs and chicken parm.  Everything was excellent. It's a family owned business and the owner came over to welcome us. Everyone was very nice and welcoming. They are still getting settled in and with every new place there's a a learning curve, (just a few days since they opened) but first and foremost there spaghetti sauce is excellent !  We're looking forward to trying all their dishes.  Almost forgot...Their cannoli was very good as well !

Calamari is delicious and fresh, the tiramisu is heaven. I've purchased the puttanesca sauce by itself to take home several times. Our waiters are also all very knowledgeable about wine, they always make the best recommendations. We love TRATTORIA ITALIA!!!

YQPaOWL2_Sr5dM6m6jAICA.text: Not a day goes by that I don't thoroughly appreciate some of the authentic, Italian owned gems we have in Henderson. This wonderful place most certainly qualifies (despite having spaghetti with meatballs and fettuccine Alfredo on the menu.) From the generous antipasti to the perfectly cooked home made pasta and dolci, this jewel is one of my favorites. They even have arancini! (a True Sicilian specialty).

K_n163CnPZ92CinKVINDXg.text: With so many good Italian places in and around Henderson, this place leaves you feeling very unfulfilled at best, a little ripped off at worst. Seems like they cut corners to Save money on some items. I have given them multiple chances but it's over.

yCvufxwnln2L7pvIiUOtOA.text: Good solid food I love that they have a nice gluten free options. The service was great and fast.  The pastas are all made in house. The gnocchi was disappointing and was very mushy. The other pastas were very good. I enjoyed their meatballs they were very flavorful. You cannot leave hungry here the portions are large.

s4Aklsg-WzLubhwpHNOLpg.text: Super excited to try this new Italian restaurant since it is so close to home. Excellent service and the food did not disappoint. For how large the portions are, the food is very reasonably priced. My husband and I both had enough for 2 full servings of leftovers. Pasquale, the owner, was so nice and accommodating. Sent us a special dish and also their tiramisu and cannolis to finish off our delicious meal.  Our server was sweet and super attentive. We will be back!

1nyAppjLVF5amnPiJO4P1w.text: This place is awesome.  Food & Service top class.   Must go place .... reasonable priced, big quantities & good friendly staff  Will have to come back  to try other items on the menu.

mQuzewglvOk7b6KferydUg.text: The BEST Italian food with amazing service! I LOVE the new wine list! Ordered bottle of Brunello - the best wine i have ever tried!!! Evening in Trattoria with my family was perfect!

cHbjCkqR8-3izpKQ5-nvTQ.text: Had an fantastic meal here today and an even more amazing experience!  I've lived in Las Vegas for 20 years and seen many "Italian" places come and go. Most are New York Italian but this is the first (off-strip) since (old) Roma Deli that is actually run by Italians!   This is no deli though. It's a Trattoria which is a type of restaurant in Italy where you can enjoy home cooked Italian food for a reasonable price, and this is exactly that type of establishment.  The dad comes in the morning to cook the sauces, dolci etc. and then the rest of the family come in throughout the day to operate the restaurant. You can tell as soon as you step through the door that the place has a buzz. The decor is cosy and warm but I think it's the personalities that really make the atmosphere what it is.   I love good food & wine, hearing the chattering of people, the clinking of glasses and the waiters talking back and fourth in Italian because it reminds me of Italy. Some lady on the table next to me wasn't a fan of the guys speaking in Italian or something and complained; I was relieved when I heard the owner tell her politely that if she doesn't like people speaking in Italian then maybe this wasn't the place for her.  Can't wait to come back! This is my new favorite spot and I will be happy to refer them any business i can to help compensate for people who can't stand authentic restaurants....I hope those people choke on their never ending salad bar!  Great food & wine at a reasonable price, warm & friendly service and a fantastic location...what else do you need?

sOV6KSSjHoqZPrNPez2uRg.text: Last night, Feb. 22, 2019, we ate dinner at Trattoria Italia in Henderson.  We had a lovely dinner and very good service.  Our server was a lovely Italian lady, named Louda and she was most attentive.  My husband, Tom started with an appetizer of Sausage and Peppers.  The sauce was excellent as well as the sausage.  He then had the Pasta Fagioli soup and that was excellent.  He had the entree of Pasta in oil and garlic and loved it.  I had their Italian salad and our server suggested to me that I could order a half portion size which I did and it was plenty.  I also ordered a 10 in. pizza which was very good and Pasta with white clam sauce.  I prefer more garlic in the pasta sauce, but I understand why restaurants usually don't use too much.  The pasta was perfectly cooked and the clams were good.  I took a lot of my leftover food home since I ordered so much.  The portions are very nice and I feel the pricing is very fair.   We had several Italian cookies which were very tasty.  They do quite a good business and they do take reservations.  We look forward to a return visit soon.

uBiStWDiKNyN46Vt3imdIw.text: I can't put in words the amount I love this place but I will try. At Trattoria you really feel at home. All of the staff are are family and they treat you like family I love that. This place ruined pizza for me. I only want their capricocia (pardon my spelling) but regular pizza is now inedible.

VTQ8sjTP8V_05jvu9efVBA.text: What can I say about this place that I haven't already.. I've been here like 5xs. Best Authentic Italian food ever! It's like my Nonna is in the kitchen cooking it, that's how good it is.  I brought my mom here & she's off the boat Sicilian.. and omg she was in love, the smile was amazing. It's hard coming from South Jersey to Vegas & looking for Italian cuisine. The Anti-pasta was banging, the prosciutto, parm, olives, roasted peppers were delicious. My mom got the Risotto w/fruiti di mare, and I got Gnocchi Tricolore(comes w/pesto, marinara & cheese sauce) soooo goood!!  And let's not forget the desserts.. the cannoli were amazing, and the tiramisu tasted perfect! We will always come here for Italian food, worth the 20mins from SW side of Vegas to East side!!

82uVQfGcktzzeEJOeIgoTQ.text: I cannot even wait till finish the meal and I must give a 5 star review!   Their calamari is sooo good with big shrimps in them!! A very nice gentleman told me that in Italy they eat their calamari with lemon only, the tomato sauce is just a big demand from the state :) , anyways, they are delicious!   For my main course I ordered Gnocchi, this is my first time. I love it! The pasta itself is soooo tasty! I can't really describe it, very rich and tatsty.   The only "downside" (not really) is that their portion is HUGE! Neither me nor my husband finished our entry. And my leftover is literally a regular Togo order portion lol!   Too bad this place is not anywhere close to my home.

F9OvSnw-rMlef9qONlPGSw.text: Food was good. Not great, but it was good. & A bit overpriced I think... don't live by here so don't think I would be back, was just in the area and wanted to try. Service was nice and friendly, 4 stars for that.

SNBPgdYUyeCYcHjON3eyfw.text: Sooooo good! Sad I found this place right before I moved! My coworkers wanted to take me out before I left and this was the place they suggested! The tiramisu was amazing best tiramisu I've ever had. Meatballs for the app were amazing as well! As well as my pasta was so flavorful I didn't need to add anything to it!

IpSvgT3iIt-9PLenFtbIVA.text: As soon as you walk in you're hit with that Italian grandma's house smell, so you know you're about to eat WELL. Let me tell you I ate until I couldn't eat anymore! I had the cheese stuffed ravioli with a red sauce and usually I'm not a fan of just cheese but omg that was delicious! The red sauce was so bright it had a nice acidity, I could eat just the sauce and be happy. So glad I tried this place it's gonna be my go-to Italian restaurant. Wish I took some pictures of the food, but my mouth was watering as soon as it came to my table, I couldn't wait! Highly recommend this restaurant :)

RrTZ-DBiJmBzDHipDCnEbQ.text: Such amazing food and bakery items! You can't go wrong with a single item on their menu.

OnicGIYHCGuGsivb2eAiVw.text: The only reason I am hesitant to leave a review is because I don't want this yummy place to get too crowded because its one of our faves. The food is amazing the service is great. A family owned authentic Italian food. Can't wait to go back!

VI-5nEt9qMpu7KVAarszqQ.text: Excellent dinner and service. Family owned restaurant. We had the chicken saltimbocca, fettuccine Alfredo, and gnocchi. Loved the bread (knots) and olive oil dipping. Italian wedding cake for dessert.

fjIsXnMVeCKmedgf_j0IiA.text: Came in from Los Angeles for a couple of days. We wanted good Authentic Southern Italian food. My brother & I are super picky & always eat Veal Parm. We both got that & so did my hubby. OMG it was just like what you get in NY or NJ. The veal was so soft & the portions were very large. The decor was warming & homey. We will be back on our next trip in a couple of weeks. Excellent food, fast Service & et waiters. If you like southern Italian then you must try this Restaurant.

9_nhh0gz5gwVjrZVd1Gu9A.text: Fabulous restaurant all around. The food is some of the best Italian I have ever had; really the best food I have had in general! Portions are large and prices are reasonable given the quality and quantity of food. The calamari is scrumptious - it tastes like it just came out of the ocean! The bread you get at the beginning is amazing, but don't over do it, because you need to leave room for your meal and a dessert! I learned this lesson the hard way the first time I dined here. The restaurant has become a family favorite and I love telling people about this gem in Henderson.

KihdG50KMOEOI8zBi7wUVw.text: This is a great place to come for some great homemade italian food for pizza lovers the pizza was great the pizza has just enough toppings so you can taste the sauce and the crust and the crust was golden brown the lobster ravioli was perfect the sauce was so good for this being the first time visiting this place I well come back

xOfkz6w6WkUsb6milJ1uPw.text: It was our first time eating here and - WOW was it good!   This pasta and gnocchi were top tier and the pizza was top 5 in Vegas easily.   Great food, we'll be back!

vgaP_pucE7Dc2pkRGGRqdw.text: This is my family's favorite for Italian food. Everything we have had is wonderful! The service is always great & staff is always so personable & welcoming. I'm torn about writing this review because I would rather not share & keep them a secret.

sbrdUTVF6TTGMV9r2OPnXA.text: This is probably the best Italian restaurant in town.The pizza is delicious and so is the pasta. The team is really friendly. We love this place !

7l0RkVLaYX_eRQSNqvek6Q.text: Authentic Italian. Toscana region if I'm not mistaken. Daughter has Penne all a Vodka and I, Chicken Piccata. Both very well served. Delicious without a long wait. The desert counter up front deserves further investigating. All the choices looked scrumptious.  Treat yourself to some truly fine dining in a casual atmosphere.

COC-HhkBjMymSdETkAd6Mg.text: This was honestly one if the worst meals I have eaten.I wish i could give a zero. The delivery was cold and terrible, the pasta is under cooked, not enough Alfredo sauce, not enough pasta. Pasta is so cheap they could've actually given us a decent portion for the price. This is ridiculous. My arugula salad had two underripe  tomato wedges. The calamari marinara tastes like ragu. The knots were flavorless. I am so disappointed and missing Montesanos.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two tomato wedges
Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Undercooked Alfredo, lacking sauce and flavor.

YsKAFqfVs99ZYXXHpAYuWw.text: Stumbled upon this place on Black Friday (I know, of all days!!!!?!!! lol) and just needed a place to rest after all the madness.  We ordered the fried mozzarella balls and lasagna, based on the recommendation of our waiter, and was very pleased.  Mozzarella balls were HUGE, and although, just 4 pieces in an order, they were perfect for 2 people. It was breaded nicely, not oily at all, and oooeeey gooey in the middle.  Lasagna has to be my favorite lasagna for the meer fact that it wasn't heavy. Don't get me wrong, I love me some baked lasagna that's cheesy and thick but, this was quite refreshing with the great amount of red sauce.   Don't forget to ask for the bread knots because (when hot and fresh) they go great with the aforementioned sauce of the lasagna.  Other than the food, we thoroughly enjoyed talking with the owners' son - I wish we got his name - as he talked about his family's business and when he first came here from Italy. It was a great conversation!  I will definitely be back =)

DhGuhISBESP4VNqTudDU3A.text: The service here was really bad and to be honest, the food is not great. I'm disappointed.

d2dgGCZy7DahtwnbVEdRuQ.text: Best Italian food outside of Italy itself. Beautiful ambience and lovely service and a friendly smile.

1rlqOtjlYR3GpPH0KujwfQ.text: Went for a late lunch and had Eggplant parm is good, I also had a side salad. The server was very kind.

rnfmJ7Lu7XIzXsE_B92sTg.text: We loved it here! We are staying in Henderson for the weekend and didn't want to drive and/or Uber into the Strip for dinner last night. I'm glad we stumbled upon this spot! The service was phenomenal and the food was incredible. We asked for recommendations on the wine (none of us are very familiar with Italian wines) and the server was SPOT ON with his recommendations! At the end of the meal the server asked if we wanted dessert- we were too full and had to decline. However, after a few minutes he comes around the corner with a giant slice of Italian wedding cake! It was amazing!!!  We would absolutely go back to this spot if we are ever back in Henderson.

wUdz_afHNF6SH_923aXDdQ.text: Super authentic Italian food. Service was great. All of my kids said it was the best pizza they've ever had in their entire lives. A little bit on the pricey side for the portion size but definitely high up in quality.

jkLtbv5GMG7JpUUWBNv7eg.text: While this may look like any of the standard little Italian restaurants in strip malls, it's probably one of the best in the area! Most of the staff and owners are Sicilian, and over 80% of them speak with heavy Italian accents. The food and sauces are all extremely well prepared, with a number of surprises. And the desert counter, which are all freshly made here on premises, look and taste like an old world Italian pastry shop. All the appetizers and entrees have surprising flavors and composition. The one not to miss is the calamari appetizer, which also has Italian tempura vegetables and shrimp in it. This is an entree and itself. Also under the appetizer menu are the clams and mussels marinara. The sauce is spicy, but you can ask for the regular tomato sauce which is delicious.

lDYLbKcXaXVWAQAqH6ijXg.text: My in-laws took us to this place last night, saying it was one of the best Italian places they'd ever been too! After last night... I'll never doubt their epicurean recommendations! This place was AMAZING!!   Two of us had the spaghetti and meatballs... three meatballs with this entree proved too much for us to eat while there!! (See picture)  One has the spaghetti with hot peppers (can't remember the name) and she loved it!!  The other had the meatball appetizer with a bed of angel hair pasta  (he is not crazy about having a lot of marinara sauce!! At the end of the night, we were all VERY happy with our choices!! Be sure to save room for dessert!

8GyJQ_c_yqLGXhQ9O_Fz-w.text: Tried the pepperoni pizza. It was the only good pizza I've had in this neighborhood for a long time. Everything tastes right: the cheese, the sauce, the crust. I've also tried a couple types of pasta. The spaghetti and meatballs had a tasty sauce, but was a little too wet for me. The linguini pesto was creamy and much easier to twirl up on my fork. The garlic knots are just dry pizza crust, not worth eating. I throw them away.

0mXd3VDEIlp3FuffT02sNQ.text: Fantastic food.   Impeccable service.   Authenticity on point.   If you are craving the best Italian food in the city - and off the strip prices! - look no further than this hidden gem right off the St Rose Pkwy exit from the I-15.   Definitely recommend.

xa9R3ZjvKdP3-V3b2wq_PA.text: Got sick from their special Valentines menu. Not bad food but okay.  Thought the meat trio chicken too dry and hard.

xfgPYNzAaqouOvpJh0Dy2g.text: Local spot close to home.  Love the lobster ravioli.  The little garlic knots are tasty to.

tZ5BCqLsw1ASHyl6v4p2Jw.text: I would find it hard to believe anyone eating at this amazing restaurant would give it anything less then 5 stars. Tonight our group enjoyed a fabulous dinner. We all had something different with dishes from lasagna to lobster ravioli and all in between. No need to go anywhere else to have great italian food.

Fh2C38Z6FEK5rWavUfIvaw.text: Excellent place for real Italian food!!! If you are looking for a REAL Italian family style restaurant, this is THE PLACE!!! The setting is like being in Italy. You will love the atmosphere. Great experience.    This is the best place we have been in Las Vegas. The service was perfect!! We made a reservation and had to queue only for 3 minutes, when the restaurant was flooded by customers arriving from everywhere. We had the pasta which is unique, a sublime pizza, an amazing tiramisu and cannoli (The list of pastries is delicious) and as we were really happy with the table we got, we decide to get an Italian red wine Chianti.  Excellent service, food and atmosphere. Thank you Ninni, Pasquale and Milena. I wish you al the best!!

bkZ9M-E2zMHMx5mXzu42Pg.text: Vastly overrated.....  1. The food was marginal - soups lacked flavor and any sort of presentation. The entrees were acceptable, but nothing to rave about.   2. Lighting is 2X  brighter than it should be.   3. Music was a mix of Christmas songs and hip-hop.....are you kidding me?   4. Our server would rate somewhere between "bland" and "cold".   5. The owner stood literally 1 foot to my left talking to the other table for at least 10 to 15 minutes. This was highly annoying - and not to mention, intrusive.    ** The place is "new" - I guess.... That is really all it has going for it. Location probably does not hurt either, so people might "fall" for it.   Will likely never return -   Overall score:  3.5/10

jDSI5VtmzO52kn-enHgXZw.text: I had been to this place last year and loved it. Went back recently to find they had expanded. Service was fantastic and food was magnificent. True authentic Italian food that took me back to holidays in Italy as a kid. Can't recommend it highly enough.

36iqDIIgnkyI8oR_-HPwpA.text: Excellent service and amazing food. We had the mushroom ravioli with four cheese ravioli, and the vegetable lasagna. Both were awesome. Oh and the garlic knots hit the spot. We will be back.

yesowTgZ4FvXrq3wqqds9Q.text: I can't figure out how this place could ever get anything less than 5 stars! The owners and servers are wonderful! The servers are attentive and we never had to wait for drinks or our next course. The food is unbelievable so delicious. Our new favorite Italian restaurant! Even as it became busy and crowded the service remained consistent.

BOH6WCqr4SZSnWys1-yriQ.text: This place was absolutely delicious and the way that this restaurant was decorated is so cute! How can you put your fork down with a pasta this good? I'm glad we came here today because we're definitely going to come more often. Thank goodness it's just down the street! If I can rate 5 or more stars, then I would.

And they're very clean hehe! Caio! Gratzi!

dbI-SVwNvmNF77pEcxWi0A.text: Hostest was super rude! Started asking if we have a reservation meanwhile the whole restaurant is empty.. the bold headed waiters cologne was horrible! Every time he walked by we all covered our noses.. the food  was amazing and Jill gave great service!

6s95ds3TJwqy37pBR98o0w.text: This Italian tavern has excellent Italian food. The people that run the place are welcoming and joyful, they are a real Italian family. Trattoria Italia is a must in Vegas!

Sw3J3Uie3E3OkWy_E2mfmA.text: This place is a great hole in the wall in henderson area. There food is authentic and there service is even better. There bread is so yummy! We will be back for more!!!

tcRsPb1xlozty1h2OJ-sXA.text: I heard great things about Trattoria Italia and my first trip there lived up to the hype.  Pasquale, one of the owners, is an Italian gentleman.  He makes every guest feel at home and like a VIP.    The restaurant is quant, simple, and comforting.  As soon as you walk in, it feels like you are in Italy.  There is no fluff or fancy features.  Instead, you feel like the focus is the food, and you will get a great home cooked meal.    We ordered the Meatballs Napoli, Eggplant Parmiagana, Gnocchi with pesto, and Lobster Ravioli.  Every dish was exactly what I had hoped for.  The meatballs were moist and airy.  The eggplant was a great balance of cheese, sauce, and eggplant.  The gnocchi was soft, without being overly chewy or doughy, and the pesto was outstanding.  The ravioli had good size bites of lobster, which remained in the perfectly folded ravioli.  On top of all that, the bread, which looks like rolls, is delicious.  I could eat that bread all day.  If you are looking for a home cooked Italian meal, this is your spot!  ALL-STAR PERSON: Pasquale.

xQNMzo978l0TpGFly-LhEg.text: So I was taking an Italian language class at UNLV & my professor recommended this place.   Service was amazing!  Restaurant was clean!  The food was amazing! I had the ossobuco and it was so delicious!  Prices were very reasonable!  Wife was extremely happy and full. Happy wife, happy life I guess!    I recommend this place to anyone who wants good Italian food at a reasonable price.

SzH17hE8YIfDxWGZ3IbrtQ.text: Best authentic ITALIAN food I have came across in the last few years. Food is absolutely amazing and the service and atmosphere is perfect for date night or to bring family/friends. MUST try the tiramisu and the meatballs (not normally a fan of meatballs but these are easily the best meatballs I've ever had)   Highly recommend!

sgjbF-pYq3yFHZ0gDeDLUw.text: Been a few times. They never disappoint. Great food, friendly efficient service, nice atmosphere. What more do you want? The price is right. I will keep going here.

fqRRAOnCWa5iPd-2KGo8kA.text: Went there and met old family friends in a group of five. Nice little Italian place. Everyone enjoyed their meals. I had the meatball sandwich which was as good.  If I'd change one thing wish it were a bit larger because I was hungry and only a 3 meatball sandwich left me wanting more. Sauce was flavorful. Also had a Cesar salad and it was excellent.  I will go back.

kMbAsOqG_vLb3Y2G7X00QQ.text: Trattoria Italia is a great Italian option in the Anthem area...  Trattoria ambiance & service:  The main dining area is one open room with a cool rustic Italian kitchen decor vibe complete with checkered red and white table clothes for a classic look.  There's a TV projection screen on the back wall displaying sports.  Our server was friendly and very busy through the night.  We had to wave her down for drink refills a couple of times but she took care of us immediately.  It appears they might have been understaffed on a Friday night.  The kitchen was great with getting our dishes for our party of 6 to us timely.  Trattoria cuisine:  We started with the squid and and calamari and both were great appetizers.  The calamari was perfectly crunchy and a generous portion.  I had the spaghetti carbonara and it was a treat.  The sauce was delish with the romano cheese and egg yolk. There was plenty of guanciale/pork in the dish to get me full.  I sampled the bff's spaghetti with clams in the white wine sauce and it was packed with flavor and had plenty of clams.  The penne and fettucine dishes at our table were also on point.    It's great to know that I don't have to drive down to the strip if I'm fiending authentic Italian dishes.  I'm looking forward to trying more dishes but that's another tale.  Enjoy! =)

DQ_8ks8a7nNnY-CD7fbDbA.text: Great food.  Staff is excellent.  Will always return.  We have eaten there many times and the food is always first class.  Sausage and Peppers , Eggplant, Lasagna all excellent.

cBxIKoYWtTlGgBVGDGoGKA.text: My daughter loves this Italian eatery as well. Located in a building with a few store fronts, by a Panera, it seems a bit boring or unsophisticated, but the inside is quaint and done with an Italian theme of paintings and decor, a small bakery with cookies and pastries greets you when you enter.  We were seated promptly and our server came over to deliver menus. Pasta, pizza and other Italian dishes are there for for whatever you're craving.  My daughter ordered the spaghetti, which she loved, my husband got cioppino which he loved, and I had shrimp pasta. I thought mine was good, although the sauce was a tad on the salty side.  Service was prompt, helpful and friendly. Would definitely try it again. (My daughter has since returned twice since we went a couple weeks ago.)

BRGtFOl-JwzlotongDlnTg.text: The food here is amazing and I love eating here and ordering food for delivery from here.  Here is what I ordered below in a picture.  Do you see where it says No olives?    Obviously whomever prepared my food did not see that and my food had a nice helping of olives.....WHY???  I'll be donating this order of food to my neighbors who will enjoy this and I'll reorder from some place else.  Wish I could say this was a good experience but unfortunately this time is a total negative experience.  The chicken is burnt, dry and over cooked, nothing like the last time I ordered it from this place and as I've said above the salad had a large helping of olives.  I love places that pay attention to customers allergy needs......Maybe if I give this place my business again the kitchen will pay attention to the tickets...but after this total negative experience, I'll have to watch other reviewers first.  Sad!!!

BwYvBavTIPpkRIAx1FriHQ.text: Pretty disappointed tonight. I had been to this place one other time and really enjoyed it. I was exhausted from work and had no energy to cook so I decided to call in an order for pick up. I got the chicken Marsala and the Baked penne for my boyfriend, he had it the last time we were there and really enjoyed it. Unfortunately tonight was a different experience. IDK if it was a different chef tonight or if they don't care about quality for the take out orders, but both entrees lacked flavor and the bread that came with the order was a bit burnt. Very disappointed. At least the cannolis were decent.

xX21ASUBNDouDeh8X4zyxA.text: I came here and it was horrible and I love Italian food! They brought us bread and it was hard, stale and luke warm. My waiter barley checked on us and it wasn't even that busy. It took 20 min for him to stop by our table so I could order some wine, which wasn't poured in front of me or even placed in a wine carafe, so I could pour it. We finally received more bread about 30 min after ordering again. And this bread was worse than the first batch. It was small and hard and burned. It took 50 min from ordering to receive our food which was less than mediocre. My friend ordered a pasta and paid $3 more for Chicken. There were 3 small pieces, she waved the server over and even he agreed that she needed more chicken, which he had the kitchen make, but the kitchen is so slow the pasta was over halfway eaten before the chicken was served. But what I don't understand the most is that had we NOT mentioned it, they would've been perfectly fine serving us those 3 small niblets of Chicken and charging us. It took the table next to us over an hour to receive their food after we conversed with them a bit because service was extremely slow and everyone was wondering where their food was. I know it's not the servers fault the kitchen is slow. But he could've stopped by, checked on us and updated us about the food. I shouldn't have to wave a server down for everything.  A few other tables around us had the raviolis and BOTH sent food back because the raviolis were still frozen. I would never return here again. I love to give small business a try but this experience was awful. I came with 1 friend and wasn't with an entire group!

jcgBjhi-OjXNyw0CCUFIRA.text: I'm not sure how much they're paying these people for the food reviews but anyways... To keep it simple, coming here was a bad experience. The service was bad they hardly came around to check on us, our serving of bread was like little burnt rocks and the second was just funny (I'll insert picture) We could hardly get our waiters attention to order a glass of wine and it wasn't even busy. The food was way overpriced for what it was and after a little under an hour of waiting around, we finally got to eat. The food is mediocre at best and overall, disappointing I ordered chicken penne with a vodka sauce and paid $3.00 to add chicken, which would be fine, but when it came out it literally had three tiny pieces of chicken on it. When I requested more chicken they gave me more, which was probably the only good part of this dinner. Two other tables that had ordered ravioli, both sent it back because it was still frozen. (Which had also taken an hour to be brought out)  Would not recommend or go back.

6QoExeFqaGc8C4PjNKiR1w.text: I'm not usually one to bash someone's business; however, the food from here was NOT good. The lasagna tasted like chef boyarde' straight from a can. I apologize for the poor review but I have to say that we will NOT be ordering from here again!!!!!

QHzhEyxrpoRKfBc8I7aFYQ.text: This place is amazing! The food is perfect portions and very flavorful. Honestly probably the best Italian food I've had in Vegas. The service is excellent. I can go on and on about how amazing this place is. If you get a chance, eat here! The desserts are great too!

Y46eZyNNCPnSM8B2UTivMQ.text: Our experience here was okay, but I am open to trying it again. I could tell the servers were busy (maybe they were short staffed). I was a server for several years, so I understand it happens. I heard one of the servers say she was too busy to take another table.   Our complimentary bread was burnt at the bottom, but we ate the top of it. I had the Fettuccine Alfredo, which was nice and creamy. My husband got the Penne Arrabiata. Some of the noodles were a little overcooked. Cannolis were good.   It took a little longer than expected to get boxes and our check, and a few other people were helping our server. We are open to coming another night, maybe when it's not as busy.

uiq1HSdhShDGAdGBK2l3qA.text: Recently hosted a ladies luncheon at Trattoria Italia for 20 in the 2nd dining area.  The set up - perfect, The lighting -perfect, The service - perfect...and the food - OMG!  I frequent this restaurant for dinner and I knew it would be a hit.  We had the Insalata Italia (generous portion), cannelloni, Eggplant Parmigiana and Lasagna. (delicious and hearty) topped off with freshly baked cookie platter.   Thanks everyone at Trattoria Italia...for making me look so good!

yx7jJQBOT2rfIdU-2S-N6g.text: I'm starting this review off with a huge thumbs up for the staff.  They are all so friendly!  My girlfriend said it as soon as we sat down!  Oh and the food was absolutely incredible!  Authentic Italian!... I'm from NY by the way.  The dessert case looked amazing, although we did not indulge.  I wish I had taken pictures.  I'll take a few when we return for another visit!  The atmosphere is cozy, very much like a mom and pop sort of restaurant.  Nothing fancy.  Those are the best restaurants in NY!  Give it a try!

NxdWCSi8_NhOaPts-yc32g.text: Food was excellent. The service was on point and professional. The meal was authentic Italian. The bread is worth coming in for. Highly recommended.

L-2dWX17qkGxntbF4CWrNg.text: The atmosphere of this place was great. Its a family run affair and it feels like it in the best way possible. The tables with the classic red and white cloth with butcher paper over the top are exactly what you imaging a classic family run Italian restaurant to look like.   The food was pretty good. Arugula salad and garlic knots started the meal and was fresh and tasty.  Wife and i split a salad and it was plenty. Entrees weren't spectacular but they were enjoyable enough to draw us back. Everything tasted very fresh although my meatballs were a little bland - will go sausage next time as i liked the sauce a lot.   The deserts though are great. Canolli tastes amazing and they have Italian waffle coolies which are discs of awesome to bring home.

0Eh02wIu9Sxk_jCmcDAGog.text: Great food great service great selection/ relaxing! Would recommend this place to anyone who loves Italian food

QwebfBE9_htghLxanPEMCw.text: They have turned this place around! Quality food. Welcoming and hospitable hosts and servers. Had pizza and salad and were treated like we were spending a zillion dollars; they treat everyone nicely.  Baked goods are outstanding. All freshly made. Cookies, pastries to eat there or take away. Split a freshly made connolli that was excellent. This place is on our list for frequent return visits.

ZawfiJqO-ns_sNtjrE6QRg.text: Finally a good real Italian restaurant in Las Vegas! I was born and raised in Italy so I'm very picky when it comes to Italian food, and I can honestly say that Trattoria Italiana is my favorite Italian restaurant. It's family owned and that gives that personal touch that you can't find in the chain restaurants; I met Milena, her husband Ninni, her brother Pasquale, her son Giovanni, Laura the waitress, and they were all so nice to me and my family! I like the atmosphere because it feels like being in a real Italian trattoria, I like the table clothes on the tables (typical in Italian restaurants but not here in the states), the bread is phenomenal, they make it with pizza dough and it's still warm when they bring it to the table, and the list goes on. I and my family will definitely go back to Trattoria Italiana!    We went there again for my husband's birthday the other day and we both had pizza: it was really good and I'm going to post pictures so you can see what I'm talking about!

Tj5iVawvr-oGGzfHDkHKhw.text: Third time eating here. Food is consistently good. Tried the penne bolognese...very good. My wife had a chicken dish ....also very good will try the meatballs next time Very much like you might find in little italy in new york if you get past the strip mall location.

I50D54vwS7HKjC2QN-pnKg.text: I need to preface this review by stating that I have lived 2 minutes away from this gold mine since it opened over 10 years ago. I am incredibly disappointed that I hadn't tried this place prior to my first trip here about a month ago.   This is our second time eating here and it was as good this time around as it was the first time. The garlic knots (which are complimentary) were warm, fresh, and delicious.  We got the mozzarella balls as an appetizer. Amazing  The balls are gigantic and the cheese is fresh. It's served on a bed of marinara which is super flavorful (if you can make the garlic knots last, the marinara sauce would go great with it).   For the main course I ordered fettuccine alfredo with chicken. It's my go to Italian dish and I am heavily judgemental of places based off of how well this dish fairs. I have to give it an A+. The fettuccine noodles were cooked al dente and there was just the right amount of sauce.   Overall, I definitely recommend this place. The serves is good, the atmosphere is nice, and you really can't go wrong with the food. If you're ever in the area, be sure to stop by, you definitely won't be disapppinted.

Kd9W2DsTAzpZN3Fj9R6L3g.text: soooo.. we really liked this place (as u can see from our previous review) until today.  called in ahead and ordered two salads for pick up for lunch,  1 caesar salad        $9.00 1 antipasto misto  $13.00  we got home and immediately started eating. upon tasting the caesar dressing, i noticed it had no flavor whatsoever. it tasted like flour mixed w/water... it was weird.  we called and very politely let the woman on the phone know that they may want to taste the dressing as it was completely flavorless.  we have caesar dressing here at home so this wouldnt have been a big deal, if her response wouldve been appropriate... she acted like we were bothering her by calling!!! like we got it for free or something!!! she could not care less .. no apology, no "hey, thx for lettn us kno!", nothing. just "ok", "ok", "ok", bye!!?    bleh... its pretty hard to screw up salads.. but they did.  $28 worth of wilted, old lettuce and flavorless white gravy!!! lol  never again. theres way too many places in this city to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yucccckkkk

Oo1voJkTw0_W7SbWm2vFFw.text: This was our first time back since the new owners and i'm very happy we came. The food was very good everything tasted so fresh. The sauces where all very creamy and flavorful. We will definitely be back to try more.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round 1 was so good we came back for 2nds. This is the Rica and spinach stuffed cannelloni. It was delicious  the sauce tasted very fresh.
Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese ravioli with creamy pesto sauce.

JwOoUEzntIuCKkam2vwOPA.text: Let me put it this way: if Trattoria Italia's Lobster Ravoli wasn't soooo incredibly good, this place would be a one star joint.   To begin with, most food comes out way under salted and under seasoned. Very bland. If you send it back it comes out just fine the second time around, but when sending food back just to achieve flavor becomes their M.O., something isn't right.   Positives: pizza is good, cioppino is good, and lobster ravioli is great.   Negatives: food is very under flavored, service at the front is very pushy. Prices are too high for what you're getting. Oh, and their caprese salad has microscopic amounts of basil, and a copious amount of spinach and lettuce. Seriously?! I didn't order a house salad with tomato and mozzarella.   As for the staff, I've just come across much more accommodating staff elsewhere. Customer service and family atmosphere is definitely lost in this dive.  Putting aside all biases from my former love of Montesano's, it really is not the best restaurant around. So many other places I will go to in the future besides trattoria.  Would I recommend this place to others? Absolutely not.  Would I come back here myself? Only for the lobster ravioli.

cKiZTmDe2LUtTPn9aiLZIA.text: Fantastic Italian atmosphere great food and delicious pastries great service friendly faces will definitely come back.

pI-Csla_SDdBN_f47p8Lfw.text: Came for dinner while staying nearby.....   great!!    Bread knots, insalata salad, meatballs, lasagna & bolognese --- all 5 stars  The pastries were fantastic as well.  Anytime we are anywhere close we will be coming back.

JU8F7gkFaP1q_W3jnhY0jQ.text: Man o man. This place is on fire  best Italian food in Nevada. Must come and try. Friendly staff great food.

Food is very tasty and Took some cannoli home for desert, meal portions are good size. Will be back to try more items on the menu, recommend it for sure.

h_iTo-kfRGacEg232zAupw.text: You rarely find an Italian restaurants in Las Vegas ran by Italians.  The experience at Trattoria Italia is always a great one and the hospitality provided by Pasquale and his family is next to none. Though I can't say this is the best option for a pool bod, it's one of my favorite. The scallops and shrimp pasta, and chicken parmigiana are two of my favorites, not to mention the homemade tiramisu which is my favorite in town!

l2id0F7MTW1f3WPGQ63F6A.text: Heaven!! What a great new find!! neighborhood type place (even though it's on stupid crazy busy Eastern) with fabulous food! Our waiter, Daniel was super nice and just attentive "enough".. didn't hover but did seem to know when to check-in. We each had a special, Shrimp in pesto w/ pappardelle was INSANELY DELICIOUS! Osso bucco was also VERY yummy! Tiramisu was SPOT ON!!  Generous portions of excellent food. Can't wait to go back and try their other dishes. This is the real deal for casual Italian dining!! Everyone's treated like family! Just what you want in an Italian restaurant. We were in shorts & t-shirts as were many others, but there were also people dressed in dressier date night attire, so I imagine anything goes.  Ohh. We also had meatball appetizer and they were done to perfection - served In a nice sweet "gravy". Very tender, perfectly put together... just firm enough to not fall apart/not "overworked". Cesar salad was simple and tasty, with just the right amount of dressing. Croutons were crispy and delicate. Garlic knots that accompanied meal were tasty too (not dripping in oil like some places). That said, their olive oil dipping sauce was YUMMY too. Yeah. We will be BACK!!

cIF0JyriQ4oV_r2eBqj0bA.text: Took my family here on Valentine's Day. They did not fail once again! Food was delicious as usual and the customer service was exceptional! I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a nice Italian spot. The menu is simple and not crowded with a bunch of stuff. I recommend the cheese ravioli, the marinara sauce was super yummy! I won't stop going here.

BHZZkYNxVDCP6_A7LOnbFw.text: Milena was a great server and the food was great. She suggested a sicillian wine that was great... will come again for sure!!

KHMmNFe8lrJsYSy3tRmdgA.text: Without a doubt best Italian food ever eaten. Provided authentic experience and accommodated every need. Service was spectacular.

ahMLKNIigTCkVWPbE-kb5Q.text: I really wanted to like this restaurant more. We came with friends who had eaten here many times and raved about it. That set the bar very high - maybe that was the problem. Our server was Santini, the owner. Very personable and very welcoming. Another reason for wanting to like it more. And they honored our reservation when they were very busy on a Saturday night. Still another significant plus. So why only 3 stars. They brought the bread knots to the table right away. A hold over from Montesano's (the prior Italian restaurant in this location)?? The knots they served were a bit stale as if they had been on the counter in the kitchen way too long. Didn't stop me from eating them, but they really weren't great. We started with a salad. The $9 salad was more than enough for 4 of us to share and still have some left over. A suggestion to Santini - offer a half size salad for $5 so that when I come with just 2 people, I can still order the salad without having to throw out half. For my entree, I ordered the chicken Marsala. It came with a side of pasta. The portion was large - no leaving here hungry. It was good, not great. My wife shared the chicken parmigiana with her friend. They split it in the kitchen for them - a nice touch. And the portion was huge. More than enough for 2 to share. Again, good but not great. My friend ordered the orecchiette with broccoli rabe and sausage. Now that was a good dish. So overall, it is a solid local Italian restaurant where you can go to eat, but not a place to go to dine. I will try it again. I really do want to like it more.

ApytINmeg-wEoXzOLcXj1g.text: Stopped in after reading the other Yelp reviews. Nice easy location with lots of parking. It was around 8:30 on a Friday night. They let us pick a seat and got our drink order right away. We ordered the pesto pasta and baked eggplant parmigiana. They brought us out some rolls that were ok, and when our food arrived and I asked for Parmesan I was shocked that he turned around to the table behind us and grabbed a bottle of Parmesan, like you would see at a pizza joint, I would have expected an Italian restaurant owned by Italians they would have fresh grated Parmesan . The portions were nice, the food was hot. My eggplant was extremely soggy and mushy with way to much mozzarella cheese so I did not eat much. The side of pasta was good and my husbands pesto pasta was good. The service was good, but could have been better.

fJIwQfVUqB4Iw7Aas9n7SA.text: Today was National Meatball Day and we thought we would try the neighborhood family owned Italian restaurant! Absolutely fantastic food and service. The Insalada Italiania was more than enough for two and was very fresh. Spaghetti and meatballs were prepared to perfection.  Again, the portions were most generous! You will be missing out if you don't try this gem.  Reservations recommended Friday and Saturday.

This place has nice ambiance, a nice dessert & pastry glass showcase in the entrance - they also have delicious desserts here! Take them to go if you are too full after your meal.  We'll be back for more!

PS_x5_1Q2claz-d2jmUWlw.text: Ate here the other night with family and it was great. Everything we had was delicious. We started with some appetizers. Calamari was one of the best calamari dishes I have had. Caprese Salad, the addition of salad to this is a perfect touch. The best appetizer we had was the eggplant. Mouth watering! 8dN-j82oeotvinbIMLPZLw.text: Good all the way around. Used Yelp to find something in the area we found ourselves in, and wow! We would have settle for a disappointment just to quickly find something to eat, but we really scored! I had the baked penne with marinara bolognese sauce, which is one of the best I have eating in a resturant.   Even if you are just kinda feeling like Italian, don't think, just head over.

F4MObl1SyBRkM7Q7_Rljsg.text: Perfect little Italian place.  Authentic staff.  Friendly great food.  Can't go wrong here.  Been there twice.

aEPbR61tH8kLnWc67vSIEA.text: Great food and great people. Gelato was amazing!!!! Also the cheese balls are to die for.

72BSg9v8BFYoEo_kTsK-7w.text: Nice little Italian place.  The homemade pastas are delicious along with the sauces.  Not the best water so we usually get pellegrino.  The canolli's are ok.  The filling is good but the shell not so much.  It would be better if they filled them at time of order.  Service isn't the best since they have a small staff so be prepared to wait and reservations a must in the evenings, as there is limited seating.  Overall the place is nice and the meatballs are good too.  We would return because of the good pasta and sauces and authentic feel.  Side note, would love to see fresh grated cheese served instead of the Parmesan.

7ofexK1N0_zyMiOe4d0X2Q.text: Ambiance is just right. Service is just perfect. They genuinely want you to have a great dining experience. But the food....wow. So very good. From the breadsticks to the penne alla vodka, perfection. Glad to have authentic Italian in the neighborhood. The New Yorker in my house is quite picky. And he was very pleased.

Yt_XGXExWvODw7dGorsTPQ.text: We loved Montessanos.  First time here since the change.  We loved it and will be back.  Service was great, food was great.

znrQ1eFmt_UGGAqhHmnMDA.text: Amazing food amazing atmosphere great service gorgeous place...you feel like you're in Italy...

NHHRD8jLX7rXTO5z26_Dxw.text: I absolutely love this place. I'm almost don't want to review it because I want it to stay somewhat of a hidden gem but it deserves praise.  It is my go-to restaurant when I have friends visiting from out of town because I am always confident they will enjoy their food.  I love their garlic knots, fried mozzarella, and their antipasto appetizer is amazing, I highly recommend it. I usually always get a pasta dish or gnocchi and they're always so accommodating if I want a different sauce than what's listed on the menu or if I'd like to add in a different protein. Their pizzas are also really delicious. The TIRAMISU is out of control good. The cannolis are authentic as it gets too. I personally love that it is an family run Italian restaurant, and I love way they absolutely stick to authentic Italian cooking. They don't over salt everything like Maggiano's or other chain restaurants, the pasta is ALWAYS cooked perfectly, and they still know American taste because the portions are huge, and you can honestly be as big of a fat kid as you want at this place.  I personally also love that Trattoria Italia is informal because it feels so welcoming, like you're walking into a friend's place. Is that cheesy? It's True though. You can come here for a date, just after work, on a Sunday evening when you look like a bum, it doesn't matter. I've even come here once with my fiancee right after the gym.  In my experience, I've never had to wait longer than what seemed normal for my food or check to come to the table, and I've been there on busy nights. Yes, there are places that have gotten my food out faster, but again, it's never been so long that we all start asking "ok where's our food?" The price point of this place is also great. I don't think it's expensive at all. It's not cheap, and it's not cheap food, but it's still way cheaper than many Italian places, if not most. I definitely recommend, and will continue to be a regular as long as it is here!

Gh9F1Evnx6M7G-BkzJDyRQ.text: This place is amazing!  Food is authentic Italian, the staff all speak in Italian!  Service and food were great!  This was my first time there and I will definitely be going back!

ROXEeVpJtIdaHkDciV4Y8w.text: Family owned. Excellent service. Excellent food. Excellent prices. I've had the meatball sub, lasagna, and several desserts; everything has been great. By far the best Italian restaurant in the area.

qCxfcpYCuUvqMQHQDI_CEQ.text: Great food amazing staff our food came out so fresh it was still smoking hot it was a great environment loved every thing about it. Doesn't look like much from the location but never judge a book by its cover the food and desserts are amazing

QNZewlXkr9cvLbYTgCN9AQ.text: What a great place to eat amazing Itailian food. I had the lobster ravioli in a vodka sauce that was the most amazing vodka sauce I ever had and the extra pieces of lobster was great. My boyfriend had the spaghetti with clams in the garlic spicy red sauce that was just to die for. The best part was the house made tiramisu. It was decadent and creamy. A must place to go.

2SkbnKgGrk3cKK1Cauuswg.text: Love this little neighborhood gem. Authentic Italian and family owned/operated. Great service, great food, great ambiance!

THr3fHbsblcj5ef3qHN2WA.text: I looked up the BEST Italian food near me and this place sure did not disappoint!  The place is a little hidden among the retail space but It's a very cozy and welcoming atmosphere. The case of baked Italian goodies up front was also very inviting.   Service was very attentive and knowledgeable with plenty of specials offered in addition to their normal menu.  The dinner rolls were little knots of dough with oil and seasonings, hit the spot. The food was the real treat!  We ordered some traditional favorites, the lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs which were both delicious.  The lobster ravioli and tortellini soup were also very tasty. I give this place two thumbs up and I highly recommend it for a great authentic Italian meal.  Will be back for sure!

NeKKDrc2uKfQ6gCgzwPdUg.text: This place is super cute, hugged in between a hair salon and what used to be a chee chee burger on Eastern + 215.  We went mid-day for lunch on a Monday and loved our experience. The food was lovely and our server was nice enough to comp our desserts and affogato for us.  I strongly recommend my dish the lobster ravioli over my friend's tricolore gnocchi (and I rarely say that about potato dishes ever) simply because the pink vodka ravioli sauce is to die for! Spongebob and Plankton knew what they were talking about when they said that ravioli secrets were worth fighting for.  Cautionary tale that their desserts are no joke in size, with cream puffs the size of saucers and truffles richer than Donald Trump. Honestly, it's like these desserts got their degrees and went back for grad school. Then to top off our visit, their affogatos were a great balance of creamy and bitter deliciousness.  There was simply no downside to our visit, I would definitely like to come back soon to try their carvery entrees.

Aoesd8o2kZB8qojun7jdWA.text: Loved this family owned Italian restaurant.   You should check it out when in Las Vegas.

Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Found a great Italian spot in Henderson NV called &#34;Trattoria Italia&#34;.  Delicious!  I had the Lobster Ravioli &amp; Wifey had Chicken Marsala

Ne0Svp7wivsGjZVEeDzkAg.text: I am not not an Italian food fan, but I wanted to try Trattoria Italiana due to the good review on Yelp. I arrived with a bottle of wine in my hand and had a reservation at 7pm. The ristorante was full and around 10 to 15 people were waiting at the entrance. The owner look at my reservation and  I got a warm welcome. No problem with the wine ($15 corkage fee). After a minutes we have been seated in the back room at a very nice table. Waiter came immediately serving some filtered water and drop some bread with olive oil at the table. Open the wine with a smile  and telling us the specials. The room was full and all table were taking. We Ordered some Calamari  (sauted) and Insulate Italiana for appetizer. 3 plates of pasta . My friend was happy to get the gluten free option. The owner touch the table during main course. My spaghetti were perfectly al dente. Dessert was tiramissu and the waiter was very nice to get out of his way to bring a little bit of raspberry and blackberry to my friend who is glutten free and dairy free. The food was serve in large portions . The service was exceptional. The prices very reasonable. The welcome from the owner was magnificent. A special thank you to DANNY R, our server who take is time, to explain the menu, give recommendation, open our wine, always smiling , spoke quietly with no rush to a difficult table of 3 who had 1 gluten-free dairy free, 1 vegan, an 1 normal menu. The entire experience deserve 5 stars! Because we spend a relaxing time with good food at a low price.

CSFr2LIO6GeHuhJYjdLd_A.text: First time trying this place. I have to say, the food here was one of the best Italian I have had in Las Vegas. I've always thought Italian is heavy food, but I have to say it was light and rich. We had lasagna, eggplant parmigiana, and the special mushroom raviolis. All was delish. Can't wait to go back and try something else.   This service was as authentic as you can get with Italians serving you. Great service by the way. You can tell there are a lot of regulars coming to eat here.  Overall, one of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas.

s_YM75UdPO-4DeiHySv7Yg.text: For sure we will become regular customers! Tried the penne arrabiatta, the pizza with arugula, and insalata italia. The staff is super friendly. If you are looking for real Italian food and atmosphere, this is the place to go!

QSS_eZOR_ygCfDzhCalF9g.text: Used to come here when it was the previous Italian restaurant and it was fantastic. Service is still great, very attentive, however the food quality needs some improvement.  Rolls were overdone, cioppino was okay but shrimp was a bit spoiled and the cheese ravioli was very plain. Definitely different then the last experience we had here.

ybl97jPrEQuhIPeYQFgSiA.text: My husband and I really wanted to like this place. We were previously pretty dedicated to Montesano's as our regular pizza place and, like apparently a lot of people, desperate to find a suitable replacement -- that it would be located in the exact same space would just be a convenient bonus.   Unfortunately, the search continues. :-/  We did a large half cheese/half pepperoni, it was just over $16 (there's a $1 charge for take out, apparently, which is...fine  \_()_/ ) and it was incredibly mediocre. I think the photo kind of speaks for itself, but it was basically the taste/look of a pizza they'd serve in a high school cafeteria. It definitely is pizza, but it's not really what you wanted.   (It's about the same level of fulfillment as Blaze, just down the street, in my opinion. Definitely not the  new regular spot I was so ardently hoping for.)  The guy that answered the phone was super nice and the staff inside was nice, and it's possible that their actual entrees are where they excel and the pizza is just an afterthought, but for our experience, and what we were looking for them to do, it comes up pretty short.

Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uuBv4RvKWC_3oaDmkQjSfw.text: Noticed we have a new little family owned Italian restaurant, and was quick to check them out.    We were immediately welcomed and seated by the staff. Our server took our drink orders, and within minutes we had water, a warm bread basket and olive oil. That bread was amazing!   We ordered Cheese Ravioli, and Baked Ziti. Both were delicious! The flavors were on point, enough Cheese, and good portions-especially the Ziti-that was huge!   The service was phenomenal. But then again, they opened only 3 days ago, so its expected.   Welcome to the neighborhood, Trattoria! We plan on visiting often. Please keep your prices reasonable, your service great, continue making delicious food, and you will be a success!

Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just in case you get thirsty...

uWaGWL9fW7Lri8_h6NmvrQ.text: That was literally the best pasta I've ever had in my life! We went there for lunch today. My SO got the risotto and that was delicious! I got the lobster ravioli and Oh My Goodness! The flavor in that vodka sauce is amazing! It looked so good I couldn't even wait long enough to take a picture. I can't wait to come back! I'm in love!

_yIOM4A5S5MQCixweJVscg.text: One of my favorite go to casual Italian spots in Henderson. Always quality service very friendly staff and top notch Italian cuisine. Highly recommend checking this spot of if you're in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood risotto

IInPCnEdPdxjrHjbotpF_Q.text: Great place. I've lived in the area for 5 years and didn't even realize this gem existed. From the moment you walk in everyone greets you warmly and makes you feel welcome. The entire staff was amicable, friendly, helpful, and professional. I never had to pour my own wine, the moment it got low, it was quickly refilled. The service is unmatched. The food even less so. Everything was extraordinarily delicious. Would recommend the lasagna, spaghetti and meatballs, and their pizza. Every bite was an experience. I can't wait to back soon.

LG4OSk5n1WgsxR__1kNYUw.text: Linguine with pesto was in a very thick cream sauce, which is not mentioned in the menu. It was the consistency of very thick, very heavy fetuccini Alfredo.  The pesto was masked by the heavy cream.

99mh85C5tMdUifDQfCXLLw.text: Amazing!!! Had the spaghetti and meat balls it was prefect. The tiramisu is a MUST!! Outstanding service.

-lzP7AGomVx2pY4J8MntdQ.text: I absolutely LOVE this place! I was hesitant on writing a review for here because I love the feeling of it being a small hidden gem but that's just selfish so here is my review:   The party I was with ordered the Chicken Alfredo, Spaghetti with meatballs, chicken caprese and garlic knots. Everything we ordered was delicious, you could tell the sauces were home made because of how good and flavorful it was. The bread was so good I could only imagine it was made from scratch. The environment was also very enjoyable, the waiters were all very friendly and helpful. Such a great place I will definitely be going back for either date nights or with the whole family.

7raBSLtfT75Yi_8zNb-kQw.text: Went here today after a friend recommended it. I was not disappointed! What a great experience!   Walked in and was immediately greeted and our group was seated. My mom is on crutches so they were very sweet about making sure our table was comfortable and she could easily access it.   The bread was very good along with the dipping oil. I had the gnocchi which was in this roasted red pepper sauce. It was wonderful! My daughter had the kids macaroni and my mom had the eggplant Parmesan. They even switched out the pasta for fresh veggies with the eggplant.   The food was great and the service was wonderful. They brought my daughter a cookie for dessert and she was so happy. Their pastry case is beyond tempting. We got a Nutella cookie and it was probably one of the best cookies I've ever had!   I will definitely return!

xwWZB5rSWWVjOG0e5lp68Q.text: Been here many times and have always been very pleased.  Ordered a few different items from the menu and all have been quite good.  Service is friendly and accommodating.

l2FE1xWpl2NUb-psuwv4Jg.text: Great little Italian restaurant located off of Eastern. We started out with the arinchini which was devine! Most places you get 2 large ones, but here you get five nestled in a plate of marinara sauce. Delish. Next I had the gnocchi with the Ninni sauce and the little lady had chicken parm. Both dishes came out perfect with the chicken parm having a great crust and the cook modifying the dish to meet the request we had. Service was top notch and the prices was appripriate. No down sides at this little gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm with a side salad instead of pasta.
Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi with Ninni sauce. So rich
Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arinchini, gotta try this

FrfJsCW1vB7ytyM9RdNN7w.text: So good. I feel like I'm back in Florence having delicious food. Everything came out hot and well seasoned. The pizza was fantastic with the perfect sauce and plenty of cheese. The crust in the pizza was perfection. I also had the pesto with chicken. Tasted so fresh and had a well balanced flavor. The atmosphere is very relaxed just like in Italy so do leave yourself some time to come relax and eat.

fWr8anVH3HLB1gwZGc7xxQ.text: Changing my review from 5 star to 2.  Looks like there may have been an owner change. Servers are RUDE.  Guy at the register is equally rude.  Bread was served burnt.  My 9 year old order spaghetti and meatballs off the kids menu. They brought her the adult order.   $80 for 3. Food is good if you can get past the rude

HczGOXGVnlmpmhdF8fvvGw.text: 1st of all, trying to order through Grubb Hubb was a very frustrating experience. Took almost 1/2 hour to place the order. We even tried calling the physical location and were told we had to go through Grubb Hubb. We finally received a Cesar Salad that was lettuce, a few croutons, some tasteless powder cheese and a very small cup of dressing. This cost $9.95. Not worth it. We ordered the Italia Pizza thinking that since it had its name in it it should be great. It was tasty but really lacking in substance. Needed a sauce of some kind a few more tomatoes. The whole experience was very disapointing.

E9TwyxJYat0dBd9PGMLL9A.text: If you're looking for authentic cuisine paired with friendly, welcoming, and courteous staff, then Trattoria Italia is where you belong!   Born and raised in Italy, I am extremely picky when it comes to Italian cuisine and in all honestly, it's been quite a challenge to try and find a True authentic Italian restaurant in town.   My husband and I actually stumbled across this gem and absolutely fell in love! The staff is on point, they all speak Italian, which I love, they are super courteous and go above and beyond with their hospitality.   The food is truly outstanding! They also have an in-house pastry chef who makes superb Italian deserts. Their cappuccino is fabulous paired with a couple of their pastries, a perfect way of ending your dinner! Everytime my husband and I visit Trattoria Italia we are full for days.   I would highly recommend Trattoria Italia if you are looking to dine somewhere authentic with a cozy and  friendly atmosphere!

py2G6TP6Gs8R19uXgU0uJg.text: The food was satisfying. and everything tasted fresh...except for the rolls. I ordered the shrimp alfredo and the person I was with ordered chicken alfredo. He wanted his chicken blackened, which wasn't an option but he received a nice helping of chicken for just $3 extra. The shrimp on the other hand wasn't. 4 shrimps for $6 extra. He also ordered a lemonade which turned out to be a small can of minute made lemonade which wasn't a charge of a whopping $3. Aside from that, we enjoyed it and will most likely return.

3ljn_0iy9ZlxK0xDtcU1mQ.text: I would give this 6 stars too, if I could! What an incredible lunch for my dad's 72nd birthday.   Calamari Lasagna  Fettuccini Alfredo with Shrimp Linguini Seafood pasta Broccoli Rabe Asparagus  Will definitely be coming back on every trip to Vegas!

M3u7jpjm8Ks-bTuWObzy4Q.text: Wow Kenny at cvs said try Trattoria for dinner.  Nice local spot off the strip. He was so right. Great food, service & atmosphere. Jill & everyone else was fantastic. Thank you for the best dinner of or stay in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jill
Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Trattoria Italia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oSpO64StIQO9w6VT_LyIqg.text: Had a pizza & Caesar salad. Can not wait to go back to this little gem that we found on Yelp. Going to try the pasta that look so go & everyone we ask said "the best"

4LXt0VchHRulRRMWh3USmA.text: ONE OF THE BEST PLACES FOR ITALIAN FOOD. I have eaten here many times before and it never disappoints. The staff is very friendly and always makes sure everything is good to go. The antipast they have if amazing, the cheeses, meats and vegetables are fresh and delicious. I usually get one of their seafood dishes and the seafood is fresh, not frozen like other places. They also have Stella on tap which is nice if you want a cold beer. The garlic knots are warm and made that day when it comes to your table. They have a large display case of desserts and pastries that changes often but my favorite is the cannoli which are always fantastic. All in all this place is very authentic and flavorful, and no it is not like Olive Garden which is fake Italian, its a million times better,  i have never been disappointed with Trattoria and will keep coming back.

5Lrkt5dR3dCRzHDvrDFNmA.text: Our group "discovered" Trattoria this trip and it has made our annual trip list of "MUST DO" restaurants!  We will be returning next year!!!  Guiseppe treated us like family - his family owns the restaurant - and every dish was absolutely 5 star!  Pricing is moderate but the food and service were 5 star all the way!  The special -  vegetable medallion - was not just beautifully presented it was outstanding in flavor!  The mushroom risotto (for those who enjoy mushrooms and a saltier taste) was exquisite!  All five of us give Trattoria FIVE STARS for food, service, wine and location!! Thank you Giuseppe and our compliments to your whole family!!! See you next year!!

BKaTFI9cS0Z7sB0R0glNRQ.text: Definitely a go to restaurant for us. With so many places to choose from, that is a statement in itself. Atmosphere is great, the food authentic and the case of desserts for selection a delight. The service is top shelf. We have dined as a couple, with friends and had dinner with guests from 8-20. It's been a sure shot for us that we enjoy often.

reke1kdrG9P8EtDbmnk1zg.text: Still love the food at the restaurant however I do have one complaint. The music. I'm sorry but I don't think rap music is appropriate as ambiance for a wonderful Italian restaurant. Nothing against rap music as I love all music but not for the Italian experience and not loud as it was.   Maybe re-think music choice?  Thanks

GIEHUvU7LAjh9T5wwumPXA.text: A hidden gem -  the food is exceptional.    Do yourself a favor and try the Eggplant Ripicni appetizer.     You can't go wrong with any of the mains.  Lovely sauces and perfect pasta.  The staff are warm and inviting.

3VbsGMZ0LZwBmGDQIwvW0A.text: Meh... That's really all I have to say.  The carbonara was nothing special, don't think I will be back.  I did get take out, but live just a couple of blocks away.  Maybe it's better in restaurant?

Ry6dTtgrOIoNP21fePECCA.text: Update to this Yelp*** Noone came. Noone called. I had to do all the calling. So I go after work with the FULL plate to get my refund and the owner MILIANA tells me "NO REFUND. I DONT BELIEVE YOU." SHe wants to give me pasta. No thank you. I told her why would  I skip lunch, come here after work only to get refunded for what I paid and take more time out of my day to gain NOTHING. She was absolutely ridiculous. And she was issued about the Yelp as she brought it up. Too bad. Stupid. Why was she fighting with  me.?? I got my refund and waves  bye. THEY DONT DESERVE MY BUSINESS. OR YOURS.   So I've been here before once and the food was really good. Today I ordered for lunch and picked up and brought back to the office. I found a long hair in the food as soon as I mixed it up. I called over to the restaurant and a male named Guisepee answers and tells me there is no one that worked there with long hair. I tell him I would like someone to bring me a replacement he said to me that I could just come back. I told him that I'm not going to clock out for a second lunch to fix thier mistake. He said 'I don't know what to tell you". What kind of bullshit restaurant is this? He tells me to give him my number and he will Call me right back. 10 mins later and still no call. What a bunch of crap. Is this the way you treat people that are patrons of your establishment Family restaurant or not Someone needs some better training  And I need my money back. I WILL Never RECOMMEND YOUR ESTABLISHMENT  AND I WILL LET EVERYONE I KNOW About THIS.

ltAZ7A2fR1CQzZI_lQ_vfQ.text: This place is amazing. They have really good authentic Italian food. I've always went to a different Italian place that is a little farther but they have went downhill so I decided to give it a try one night with my family. Everything was delicious and everyone loved what they ordered.  They have complimentary garlic knots which are so good! The service is really nice and everyone is super friendly.  I ordered the chicken Marsala and I was not disappointed. It tasted authentic and amazing; there isn't anything bad I can say! We also tried chicken Alfredo, seafood risotto, and a pizza. They have a lot of pastry's and desserts that I didn't get to try but they looked very good. Definitely give this place a try and see what you think!
